Many are also eager to enter politics rather than just critique, with over a third considering running for office. Climate change remains a defining global worry, even amidst personal financial anxieties.

items.title: ASK Property Fund invests Rs 340 crore in Mantra Group’s 3 residential projects in Mumbai, Pune
items.summary: ASK Property Fund has invested Rs 340 crore in Mantra Group's real estate projects. This funding will help revive stalled housing projects in Mumbai and Pune. The investment will benefit hundreds of families. It also supports Mantra Group in acquiring new projects.

items.title: Sensex jumps over 1,000 points from day's low; Nifty 50 ends near 25,800 on India-US trade deal hopes— 10 key highlights
items.summary: The Sensex ended at 83,878.17, up 302 points, or 0.36%. From the intraday low, it was a solid 1,017-point rebound. The Nifty 50 closed the day with a gain of 107 points, or 0.42%, at 25,790.25.

items.title: Silver rate today: Is it too late to buy silver as prices top $84? Robert Kiyosaki answers
items.summary: In a social media post, Kiyosaki recommended investors to buy silver even when the white metal hit a record high of $84. “&nbsp;Is it too late to buy silver? I say “No,” Kiyosaki said in a post on X.

items.title: Donald Trump tries to break the Fed. What the clash means for India
items.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell revealed the Justice Department served subpoenas threatening criminal indictment over his Senate testimony, which he calls a "pretext" to pressure the Fed on interest rates. President Trump denied knowledge but criticized Powell, escalating a conflict over central bank independence and monetary policy.

items.title: Biocon arm gets USFDA nod for generic Everolimus tablets
items.summary: The approval granted by the US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) is for the Abbreviated New Drug Application (ANDA) for Everolimus tablets for oral suspension in 2 mg, 3 mg and 5 mg strengths

items.title: Retail in 2026: Growth, competition, and the case for consumption-led policy
items.summary: India's retail sector enters 2026 on firmer footing. Consumption momentum strengthened through 2025, reflecting a market that is stabilising and preparing for a more competitive growth phase. Consumers are making deliberate choices, balancing essentials with occasion-led discretionary spending.

items.title: Onemi Technology, Alcobrew Distilleries India, Kusumgar get SEBI nod for IPO
items.summary: Onemi Technology, Alcobrew Distilleries India, Kusumgar have received final nod from SEBI for their IPOs. Onemi focuses on digital loans, Alcobrew produces premium liquor, and Kusumgar specializes in engineered fabrics, each aiming to raise significant funds for expansion and corporate purposes.

items.title: SIM binding could end physical travel SIMs but boost eSIM adoption: Experts
items.summary: New government rules will affect foreign SIM cards. Popular apps like WhatsApp will stop working on secondary numbers. This change is set to boost eSIM sales for travelers. Companies offering travel eSIMs anticipate growth. Travelers can keep their Indian number active while using data abroad. This shift offers affordable digital connectivity.

items.title: Why did Hitachi Energy, BHEL, Cummins India and other capital goods stocks crash up to 6.5% today? Explained

items.title: Anarock enters project management services vertical, hires 550 people to grow business
items.summary: Property consultant Anarock is expanding into project management and engineering services. The company has hired 550 employees for this new venture. Anarock anticipates significant revenue from this diversified business. This move aims to offer comprehensive real estate solutions to clients. The firm is leveraging technology and experienced talent for project delivery.

items.title: Air conditioners price likely to rise 7-8% this season due to new star rating norms: Report
items.summary: The report stated that the upcoming price increase will be driven by the implementation of the new star-rating regime, effective from January '26, and by persistent commodity inflation

items.title: MAN Industries gets pipe supply orders worth Rs 550 cr
items.summary: MAN Industries has won new orders totaling Rs 550 crore. These orders are for coated line pipes and related solutions. The company will execute these contracts over the next six months. This brings MAN Industries' unexecuted order book to Rs 4,600 crore. The company supplies specialized steel pipes for transporting oil, natural gas, and water.

items.title: Budget 2026: Sustaining India’s growth depends on consumption, investment, and fiscal consolidation
items.summary: Union Budget 2026: As we move into 2026, India's economic landscape is flourishing with notable strides in both manufacturing and services. The dual engine of rising private consumption and investment is propelling this success, leading experts to amend their growth predictions positively.

items.title: Peter Thiel believes every entrepreneur's goal should be to build a monopoly, ‘one-of-a-kind company’ has no competition
items.summary: Billionaire investor Peter Thiel believes that every entrepreneur's goal should be to build a monopoly company, and that founders who build a ‘one-of-a-kind’ company, that's doing something different, can ensure success.

items.title: America’s labour productivity is rising—This should imply a higher neutral rate of interest and tighter Fed policy
items.summary: A burst of US productivity, possibly powered by AI, is helping contain inflation—but it may also mean the Federal Reserve is pursuing an easier monetary policy than it should. If efficiency gains are lifting America’s neutral rate, then policy ought to tighten, not loosen.

items.title: Union Budget 2026 to be presented on February 1, Sunday
items.summary: Union Budget 2026: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will present the Union Budget on February 1, 2026. Parliament will convene for the Budget session on January 28, 2026. Companies with strong consumption and leasing are favored.

items.summary: The next two decades will decide whether India turns its demographic dividend and urban surge into lasting prosperity—or squanders them as ageing and climate pressures close in. Between now and 2047 lies a narrow window to reform, execute plans and shape an economy we can be proud of.

items.summary: Indian Hotels Company, or IHCL, has achieved a significant milestone. The company secured trademark registration for the 'Taj' sonic sound. It recognizes sound as a core brand asset.

items.summary: Kohinoor Foods share price was the biggest the laggard among the pack. The stock fell nearly 3.37% to  ₹24.91 apiece on Monday. Sarveshwar Foods and GRM Overseas shares plunged over 2%.

items.title: Budget 2026: Trump tariffs or not, trade power should stay with India
items.summary: India Budget 2026: A 1985 Plaza Accord saw global powers coordinate to devalue the dollar, impacting Japan severely. Today, similar economic conditions and Donald Trump's protectionist policies are reshaping global trade. India, historically less integrated, may find an unexpected advantage in this shift towards self-sufficiency, potentially mitigating direct trade shocks.

items.summary: Biocon's arm, Biocon Pharma Ltd, has secured USFDA approval for its generic Everolimus tablets. This medication aids in treating tuberous sclerosis complex, a rare genetic disorder causing tumors. The approval for 2mg, 3mg, and 5mg strengths bolsters Biocon's drug offerings, providing a new treatment option for adult and pediatric patients with specific TSC-related conditions.

items.summary: Alembic Pharmaceuticals has secured tentative approval from the USFDA for its Bosutinib tablets. These tablets are used to treat certain types of cancer, specifically chronic myelogenous leukemia. The approval covers the 400 mg strength. This development marks a significant step for Alembic in the US market. The company previously received final approval for other strengths of the same drug.

items.title: ‘Correction was overdue’: Kranthi Bathini on what investors should do

items.title: Watch: Explained: What are Supplementary Demands for Grants?

items.summary: "Allowing imports of cement from Pakistan, therefore, carried with it the additional risk in that it provides an effective cover for smuggling of contraband goods and harmful weapons and ammunition concealed in cement bags which comes in rakes and trucks, in the hands of disruptionist elements," he said.

items.title: Moneycontrol Exclusive: Govt plans overhaul of tax administration for smooth GST rollout
items.summary: The government has readied plans for a major change in India’s tax administration structure, including overhauling the Central Board of Excise and Customs (CBEC) to ensure a glitch-free roll-out of a nation-wide goods and services tax (GST).

items.title: Sensex, Nifty wobbly; Hind Zinc, SBI, Force Motors most active
items.summary: Asian Paints, SBI, Tata Motors, HUL and Maruti Suzuki are top gainers while ONGC, Axis Bank, MM, Bajaj Auto and Hero MotoCorp are major losers in the Sensex.

items.title: Uber  redBus partner with ixigo for train travellers
items.summary: ixigo, India’s leading mobile travel marketplace has announced partnerships with Uber and redBus to enable instant bookings for cabs and buses natively within ixigo trains app.

items.title: Workload in IT to come down due to AI; jobs to reduce: Genpact
items.summary: But along with that the employment growth rates have started to dip, NV 'Tiger' Tyagarajan says. The percentage addition of employees in India will not be same as past. And due to advancements, a workforce with higher skill sets is required for the IT industry, he says.

items.title: Pixel launch: Is Google Assistant's AI an assault on privacy?
items.summary: Sure, artificial intelligence can make life simpler by suggesting you places to eat, tell you weather, or even crack a joke.  The more you use it, the more it learns about your habits and preferences. The protocols pertaining to artificial intelligence, or the lack of it, make our data less secure and more vulnerable.

items.title: Up over 200% in 1 year, what's buzzing with Borosil Glass?
items.summary: Shares of Borosil Glass Works have increased threefold over the past one year as the company has posted strong revenue and EBIDTA growth over the past few quarters.

items.title: Why you should not be always chasing returns
items.summary: Most people focus on returns and chase products that offer the best returns at any point.

items.title: Jhunjhunwala-partnered fund buys stake in TFCI: What's buzzing?
items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
